title: Natasha
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Broadway (New York, N.Y.)
abstract: On your toes (Tim Flavin)--Romeo and Juliet (Anthony Dowell, choreography Kenneth MacMillan)--Carmen (Denys Ganio, choreography Roland Petit)--Proust remembered (Denys Ganio, choreography Roland Petit)--Begin the beguine (Gary Chryst, choreography Peter Gennaro)--Bach sonara (Denys Genio, choreography Maurice Bejart)--Prelude from Les Sylphides (solo, choreography Mikhail Fokine)--Manon (Anthony Dowell, choreography Kenneth MacMillan)--Dying swan (solo, choreography Mikhail Fokine)--A Month in the country (Anthony Dowell, choreography Frederick Ashton)--Showcase (Norman Maen Dancers, choreography Norman Maen)
description: Documentary featuring internationally acclaimed Russian born ballet dancer, Natalia Makarova. Natalia introduces and provides a brief background to each of the ballet excerpts included in this dance documentary demonstrating that not only is she a wonderful dancer but also she possesses a charming and humorous personality. Her partners include Anthony Dowell, Denys Ganio, Gary Chryst, Tim Flavin, and the Norman Maen Dancers supported by the music of the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Barry Wordsworth. In 1983 Natalia won a Tony Award for Best Actress in a Musical.
